subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 5 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 5 moles H2 produce 5 moles H2O.

subject: Chemistry
q: Which factor primarily determines the chemical reactivity of an element in a period?
options: Effective nuclear charge and valence electron configuration
exp: Reactivity across a period depends on effective nuclear charge and valence electrons, influencing ionization energy and electron affinity.

q: A weak acid HA has Ka = 0.000996 and initial concentration 0.043 M. Using approximation, what is the hydrogen ion concentration [H+]?
exp: For weak acid HA, [H+] ≈ sqrt(Ka×c) = sqrt(0.000996×0.043) ≈ 0.006544 M.

exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2H2 + O2 → 2H2O. 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so 4 moles H2 produce 4 moles H2O.

subject: Chemistry
q: A weak acid HA has Ka = 0.000861 and initial concentration 0.048 M. Using approximation, what is the hydrogen ion concentration [H+]?
exp: For weak acid HA, [H+] ≈ sqrt(Ka×c) = sqrt(0.000861×0.048) ≈ 0.006429 M.
